content.title: Post-Matric Scholarship To VJNT Students - Maharashtra
content.details: The Government of Maharashtra launched a scheme namely “Post-Matric Scholarship to VJNT students” vide G.R. No. EBC 1068/83567/57 dated 24.12.1970 in 1970. This scheme was started by the Government to encourage the student of the Vimukta Jatis & Nomadic Tribes (VJNT) to undergo Post-Matric higher education. The scheme provides financial assistance for education, including Tuition Fees, Exam Fees, and Maintenance Allowance.
benefits: Maintenance allowance for hostellers ranging from ₹90 to ₹190 per month.
Maintenance allowance for day scholars ranging from ₹150 to ₹425 per month.
100% coverage of Tuition Fees and Exam Fees for eligible students.
eligibility: Parent's/Guardian's annual income should be less than or equal to ₹1.50 Lac.
Applicants should belong to the VJNT category.
Applicants must be residents of Maharashtra.
Applicants must be pursuing an education course approved by the government from the class Post-Matric.
75% attendance is mandatory for the current year.
exclusions: Students engaged in full-time employment are not eligible.
Repeaters are not eligible for the scholarship for that standard.
No scholarship will be paid to the students under this scheme from the date he/she accepts another Scholarship/stipend.
content.application_process: Online. Applicants must register on the official website and fill in all mandatory details.
documents_required: Caste certificate issued by a competent authority.
Caste Validity Certificate (Mandatory for Professional Degree courses).
HSC or SSC marks sheet or last examination marks sheet.
Declaration certificate of parents/guardians about the number of children beneficiaries.

faqs.question: How much maintenance allowance to be paid to the students of V.J.N.T. category?
faqs.answer: All the eligible students of the VJNT category are paid maintenance allowance from ₹90 to ₹190 per month for hostellers and ₹150 to ₹425 per month for day scholar students.

faqs.question: Will a student be eligible for the scholarship if he/she gets admission to a government hostel?
faqs.answer: Yes, if the applicant gets admission in a government hostel then he will be eligible for only 1/3rd amount of the hostler.

faqs.question: What are the benefits given to the students who enrolled in B.Ed and D.Ed courses?
faqs.answer: The student of B.Ed & D.Ed courses is applicable 100% benefit under this scheme in Tuition Fees, Exam Fees, and Maintenance Allowance.

faqs.question: Who can apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: An applicant who belongs to the VJNT category and is a resident of Maharashtra State is eligible for the scheme.
